general.question: What is ACTMS?
general.answer: ACTMS (Anti-Corruption Tender Management System) is a comprehensive platform designed to ensure transparency and prevent corruption in government and organizational tender processes. It uses AI-powered detection to identify suspicious activities and maintain audit trails.

general.question: How does ACTMS prevent corruption?
general.answer: ACTMS prevents corruption through multiple mechanisms: automated audit logging of all activities, AI-powered anomaly detection to identify suspicious bidding patterns, transparent document management with information extraction, and real-time alerts for unusual activities. All actions are tracked and cannot be deleted or modified.

general.question: Who can use ACTMS?
general.answer: ACTMS is designed for government agencies, public organizations, and private companies that conduct tender processes. It serves procurement officers who manage tenders, companies that submit bids, and auditors who monitor the process for compliance and transparency.

general.question: Is my data secure in ACTMS?
general.answer: Yes, ACTMS implements robust security measures including encrypted data storage, secure file handling, user authentication, and comprehensive audit logging. All sensitive information is protected and access is controlled. The system maintains data integrity and provides full audit trails.

general.question: How do I get started with ACTMS?
general.answer: To get started: 1) Navigate to the Tender Management page to upload your first tender, 2) Companies can then submit bids through the Bid Submission page, 3) Monitor AI analysis results in the AI Analysis section, 4) Use the Dashboard for comprehensive insights, and 5) Access help anytime through this chatbot.

tender_management.question: How do I upload a new tender?
tender_management.answer: To upload a tender: 1) Go to the Tender Management page, 2) Click the 'Upload New Tender' tab, 3) Fill in required details (title, description, department, estimated value, deadline), 4) Optionally upload supporting documents (PDF, DOC, DOCX, TXT), 5) Click 'Submit Tender'. The system will automatically extract key information from uploaded documents.

tender_management.question: What file formats are supported for tender documents?
tender_management.answer: ACTMS supports PDF, DOC, DOCX, TXT, and RTF files up to 10MB in size. Documents are automatically processed using NLP to extract key information such as requirements, dates, contact information, monetary values, and technical specifications.

tender_management.question: Can I edit a tender after submission?
tender_management.answer: For transparency and audit purposes, tenders cannot be edited after submission. However, you can change the tender status (active, closed, cancelled) and upload additional clarification documents. If major changes are needed, create a new tender with updated information.

tender_management.question: How does document information extraction work?
tender_management.answer: ACTMS uses advanced NLP (Natural Language Processing) to automatically extract key information from tender documents including monetary values, important dates, contact information, technical requirements, and specifications. This extracted information is displayed in the tender details for quick reference.

tender_management.question: What information is required for a tender?
tender_management.answer: Required fields include: tender title, detailed description, issuing department, estimated value, and submission deadline. Optional information includes supporting documents, contact details, and specific requirements. The more detailed information you provide, the better companies can prepare their bids.

tender_management.question: How do I set tender deadlines?
tender_management.answer: When creating a tender, select the submission deadline using the date picker. The deadline must be in the future. The system will track time remaining and show countdown information to bidders. Expired tenders are automatically flagged and no new bids can be submitted.

bidding.question: How do I submit a bid?
bidding.answer: To submit a bid: 1) Go to the Bid Submission page, 2) Select an active tender from the dropdown, 3) Enter your company information and contact details, 4) Specify your bid amount, 5) Write a detailed proposal explaining your approach, 6) Click 'Submit Bid'. The system will automatically validate and analyze your submission.

bidding.question: What makes a bid suspicious?
bidding.answer: Bids may be flagged as suspicious for various reasons: unusual bid amounts compared to estimated values, very short or generic proposals, submissions outside normal business hours, patterns that deviate from typical bidding behavior, missing required information, or inconsistent company details.

bidding.question: Can I submit multiple bids for the same tender?
bidding.answer: The system allows multiple bids from the same company for a single tender, but this may be flagged for review depending on your organization's policies. Each bid is analyzed independently by the AI system for potential anomalies.

bidding.question: What should I include in my proposal?
bidding.answer: A strong proposal should include: your approach and methodology, relevant experience and qualifications, detailed timeline, team composition and expertise, cost breakdown if applicable, and why you're the best choice. Proposals should be at least 50 words and demonstrate clear understanding of the requirements.

bidding.question: How is my bid analyzed by AI?
bidding.answer: The AI system analyzes multiple factors including bid amount relative to estimated value, proposal content quality and length, submission timing patterns, company bidding history, and text analysis of your proposal. The system generates an anomaly score and flags potentially suspicious patterns.

bidding.question: Can I withdraw a submitted bid?
bidding.answer: For transparency and audit purposes, submitted bids cannot be withdrawn or modified. All bid submissions are permanently recorded. If you need to make changes, you can submit a new bid with updated information, though multiple bids from the same company may trigger additional review.

bidding.question: When will I know if my bid is accepted?
bidding.answer: Bid acceptance depends on the tendering organization's evaluation process and timeline. ACTMS provides the submission and tracking platform, but final decisions are made by the tender issuing authority. You can monitor your bid status in the system and contact the issuing department for updates.

ai_analysis.question: How does the AI analysis work?
ai_analysis.answer: ACTMS uses machine learning algorithms, specifically Isolation Forest for anomaly detection. The AI analyzes bid patterns, submission timing, proposal content, bid amounts, and other factors to identify potentially suspicious activities. The system learns from historical data to improve detection accuracy.

ai_analysis.question: What is an anomaly score?
ai_analysis.answer: An anomaly score is a numerical value indicating how unusual a bid appears compared to normal patterns. Scores typically range from -1 to 1, where lower scores indicate more anomalous behavior. Bids with very low scores (typically below -0.1) are flagged as suspicious for further review.

ai_analysis.question: How accurate is the AI detection?
ai_analysis.answer: The AI system's accuracy improves with more data. It's designed with a 10% contamination rate, meaning it expects about 10% of bids to be anomalous. The system provides explanations for its decisions and should be used as a tool to assist human reviewers, not replace human judgment.

ai_analysis.question: Can I improve my anomaly score?
ai_analysis.answer: Yes, you can improve your score by: submitting detailed, well-written proposals (50+ words), bidding reasonable amounts relative to estimated values, maintaining consistent company information, submitting during business hours, and demonstrating genuine engagement with tender requirements.

ai_analysis.question: What triggers a suspicious bid alert?
ai_analysis.answer: Alerts are triggered by: bids with very low anomaly scores, unusual timing patterns, bid amounts significantly different from estimated values, very short or generic proposals, inconsistent company information, or patterns that deviate significantly from normal bidding behavior.

ai_analysis.question: How often is the AI model updated?
ai_analysis.answer: The AI model can be retrained anytime through the AI Analysis page when sufficient new data is available (minimum 10 bids). Regular retraining helps the model adapt to new patterns and improve accuracy. The system administrator can initiate retraining as needed.

technical.question: What browsers are supported?
technical.answer: ACTMS is a web-based application built with Streamlit that works on all modern browsers including Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge. For the best experience, use the latest version of your preferred browser with JavaScript enabled.

technical.question: How do I report a technical issue?
technical.answer: If you encounter technical issues: 1) Try refreshing the page, 2) Check your internet connection, 3) Clear your browser cache, 4) Try a different browser, 5) If problems persist, contact your system administrator with details about the error and steps to reproduce it.

technical.question: Can I export data from ACTMS?
technical.answer: Yes, various data export options are available including downloading tender documents, exporting chat history from the chatbot, and accessing analysis reports. Specific export capabilities may depend on your user permissions and role in the system.

technical.question: How is data backed up?
technical.answer: ACTMS uses SQLite database for data storage with regular backup procedures. All tender documents are stored securely on the file system. The system maintains comprehensive audit logs that cannot be deleted, ensuring data integrity and compliance with transparency requirements.

technical.question: What happens if the system goes down?
technical.answer: ACTMS is designed for reliability with error handling and data persistence. If temporary issues occur, your data is safe and the system will resume normal operation. For extended outages, contact your system administrator for status updates and recovery procedures.

technical.question: How do I change my password or account settings?
technical.answer: ACTMS currently operates without individual user accounts for simplified access. If your organization implements user authentication, contact your system administrator for account management procedures including password changes and access permissions.

compliance.question: How does ACTMS ensure audit compliance?
compliance.answer: ACTMS ensures compliance through comprehensive audit logging of all activities, immutable record keeping, timestamp tracking, user action logging, document version control, and AI analysis reporting. All actions are recorded and cannot be modified or deleted.

compliance.question: What anti-corruption measures are implemented?
compliance.answer: Anti-corruption measures include: transparent bid submission process, AI-powered fraud detection, comprehensive audit trails, real-time monitoring and alerts, anonymous bid analysis, standardized evaluation criteria, and automated detection of unusual patterns or behaviors.

compliance.question: Can audit reports be generated?
compliance.answer: Yes, the system maintains detailed audit logs and can generate reports on all activities including tender submissions, bid submissions, AI analysis results, and system alerts. These reports support compliance requirements and transparency initiatives.

compliance.question: How long is data retained?
compliance.answer: Data retention policies depend on your organization's requirements and local regulations. The system is designed to maintain all records indefinitely for transparency and audit purposes, but specific retention periods should be configured according to your compliance needs.

compliance.question: Are there access controls?
compliance.answer: ACTMS can be configured with various access controls depending on implementation. The system supports role-based access, activity logging, and permission management to ensure appropriate access to sensitive information while maintaining transparency.
